title: Keeping secrets with adults isn’t always safe.
description: If someone told you to hide something from your parents or friends, they might be trying to control you. Safe people don’t need you to stay quiet or lie for them.
tips: You are allowed to talk to someone else, even if they told you not to.
Secrets that make you feel weird or heavy are worth sharing with someone you trust.

title: You don’t have to say yes just to keep someone happy.
description: If someone makes you feel like you’ll get in trouble or disappoint them if you say no, that’s pressure — and it’s not okay.
tips: You’re not responsible for someone else’s feelings.

title: You don’t have to send photos of yourself to anyone.
description: Even if someone asks nicely, requests a selfie, or says it’s just for fun — it’s your choice, and you never owe them anything.
tips: Anyone who really respects you won’t keep asking.
You can stop responding and talk to someone safe.

title: It’s okay to like compliments — but some are too much.
description: If someone says you’re special, mature, or different from others, they might be trying to lower your guard. You’re allowed to enjoy kindness, but also question it.
tips: Someone who truly likes you won’t make things confusing or uncomfortable.
Feeling flattered and feeling weird can happen at the same time — that doesn’t make it your fault.

title: Some things shouldn’t be shared — especially with adults.
description: If someone shows you private things (like pictures or their body), that’s not okay. They might be trying to test your reaction or break a boundary.
tips: You’re allowed to feel shocked or unsure. That’s a normal reaction.
Please talk to someone about it — even if you didn’t stop it at the time.

title: It’s okay to not remember — or not be sure yet.
description: Sometimes our brains protect us from things we’re not ready to think about. That doesn’t mean you’re making it up. It just means you’re still figuring it out.
tips: You don’t have to explain everything today.
You can talk to someone safe when you feel ready.

title: Nobody should touch you in a way that feels wrong.
description: Even if they act nice or say it’s normal, your body is yours. If something made you uncomfortable, it matters.
tips: It’s okay to say no, even to adults or family.
What felt weird to you is worth paying attention to.
